articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Turf Institute
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Turf Institute
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, looked round the Turf Institute of the Bioengineering Branch under the State Academy of Sciences newly constructed by soldiers.
					 Going round different places of the institute, he acquainted himself in detail with its construction and research work there.
					
					 When he reached the two-storied main building, he said he was pleased to see the green-tiled outer wall. He praised the soldier-builders for erecting the monument to the institute in an imposing manner.
					
					 After looking round the room devoted to the achievements in scientific researches, scientific information study room, e-library, genetic resource study room, biochemistry study room, laboratory, analysis room, etc, he highly praised them for successfully constructing the institute.
					
					 Noting research rooms and laboratories were built well to suit the nature of the institute, he underscored the need to take measures for providing it with necessary equipment and scientific and technological information.
					
					 He went round office rooms, dining hall, bed rooms and others to learn about the working and living conditions of its researchers and employees.
					
					 Then he toured the Scientific Research Greenhouse.
					
					 Seeing various species of turf being cultivated at the greenhouse, he said that what is essential in the research into turf is to cultivate turf which remains green all the year round, strong in resistance to cold and treading and high in ornamental effect.
					
					 He also went round an open-air experimental plot comprising the experimental field for species, experimental field for seed-selection and vegetative propagation, experimental field for turf cutting and other fields.
					
					 Learning about the growth of turf in those fields, he called for conducting research into species suited to the areas distinct in four seasons and different in their climatic conditions.
					
					 He noted that it is good to set up branches of the institute in the eastern, western and central regions.
					
					 He also examined "Sondulmil", turf of Korean species which remains green all the year round, under test-cultivation at the institute.
					
					 There is such turf with strong vitality as Songchon Turf in the country but it remains green in a short period, he said, underscoring the need for the institute to intensify the research to solve that problem.
					
					 He also underlined the need to plant trees, create grassland and cultivate flowers and other plants in all lands except the cultivated land so that there may be no land left waste or overgrown with weed.
					
					 That day he examined various type machines including those for collecting turf seeds, sowing them and cutting turf and a ground-stiffening roller machine contrived and manufactured by the Academy. He called for widely applying them.
					
					 He said he would send modern equipment for researches to the institute.
					
					 He underscored the need to turn the country into a socialist thriving nation and make it richer and more beautiful for the people by dynamically conducting the land management under a long-term plan.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Choe Thae Bok, Pak Thae Song and Hwang Pyong So.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Autographs to People of Various Social Strata
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Autographs to People of Various Social Strata
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un sent his autographed replies to party cell secretaries of the people's security field, people of different fields and teachers after receiving their letters. 
					 They included the participants in the meeting of cell secretaries of the Kangwon Provincial People's Security Bureau of the Workers' Party of Korea, Pak Song Min, chief of staff of the 3rd Battalion of the Youth Shock Brigade of the Ministry of Railways, and Kim Jong Sil, street cleaner of the Chollima Work-team of the Phyongchon District City Facilities Management Station in Pyongyang.
					
					 Kim Jong Un in his autograph to teachers of Namhung Senior Secondary School in Waudo District, Nampho City, said that to educate children well is the most important issue for the country, hoping that they will train more talents with the pride of bringing up the future of the country. 
					
					 In their letters they, reflecting best wishes of all the service personnel and people, sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health for the eternal prosperity of Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea and happiness of all generations.

articles.title: DPRK Plans No Deal over Pae Jun Ho Case: Spokesman
articles.content:
DPRK Plans No Deal over Pae Jun Ho Case: Spokesman 
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA Sunday as regards the issue of American Pae Jun Ho, sentenced to 15 years in prison for the crimes of plotting the subversion of the DPRK:
					 Pae Jun Ho was arrested and prosecuted for various crimes he committed in the DPRK aimed at the state subversion. He entered the DPRK with a disguised identity in an intentional way under the back-stage manipulation of the forces hostile toward the DPRK.
					
					 During investigation by a relevant institution and trial, Pae confessed and admitted his crimes. A variety of his belongings also confirmed his crimes for which he was convicted.
					
					 Whenever Americans were put under custody in the DPRK for violating the country's law, former or incumbent high-ranking American officials flew to Pyongyang and apologized for their crimes and promised to prevent the recurrence of similar incidents.  Therefore, the DPRK showed generosity and set them free from the humanitarian point of view.
					
					 Pae's case proves that as long as the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK remains unchanged, humanitarian generosity will be of no use in ending Americans' illegal acts.
					
					 As long as the U.S. hostile policy goes on, American's illegal acts should be countered with strict legal sanctions. This is a conclusion drawn by the DPRK.
					
					 Some media of the U.S. said that the DPRK tried to use Pae's case as a political bargaining chip. This is ridiculous and wrong guess.
					
					 The DPRK has no plan to invite anyone of the U.S. as regards Pae's issue.

articles.title: DPRK FM Congratulates His Italian Counterpart
articles.content:
DPRK FM Congratulates His Italian Counterpart 
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a message to Emma Bonino on April 30, congratulating her on her appointment as foreign minister of Italy. 
					 The message wished her big success in her new job, expressing belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries will continue to develop in mutual interests.

articles.title: Fate of KIZ Depends on S. Korean Authorities: Spokesman
articles.content:
Fate of KIZ Depends on S. Korean Authorities: Spokesman
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The Kaesong Industrial Zone (KIZ) is now on the verge of complete shutdown after a decade of operation as a valuable gain of the June 15 joint declaration and a symbol of the north-south cooperation and exchanges.
					 Far from feeling responsibilities for the prevailing grave situation, the present puppet authorities of south Korea have behaved impudently like a thief crying stop the thief.
					
					 They are urging the north to re-open and re-link the traffic and communication line that have been cut off, while claiming that the DPRK is to blame for the situation.
					
					 In this regard the spokesman for the Policy Department of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK gave an answer to a question put by KCNA Sunday.
					
					 Revealing the confrontation and war moves perpetrated by the chief culprits who pushed the KIZ into the crisis of the complete shutdown while crying out for "normal operation", the spokesman continued:
					
					 Consistent and clear is the stand of the DPRK.
					
					 If the south Korean puppet forces are truly worried about the destiny of the KIZ and are fearful of the catastrophic north-south relations at a war-like state, they should take measures of stopping all the hostile acts and military provocations, the source of the prevailing situation.
					
					 Herein lies a way for re-opening the traffic, re-linking the communication line and putting the KIZ on a normal operation.
					
					 They should also know that this is the way for achieving the country's reunification and guaranteeing peace and prosperity desired by all Koreans.

articles.title: DPRK Hero Title Awarded to Traffic Controller
articles.content:
DPRK Hero Title Awarded to Traffic Controller 
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The DPRK awarded the title of the DPRK Hero, a gold star medal and Order of National Flag First Class to Ri Kyong Sim, a traffic controller of a district branch of the Traffic Command Corps of the Pyongyang City People's Security Bureau.
					 The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK promulgated a decree on it on Saturday.
					
					 Ri dedicated herself to ensuring the traffic order in the capital city and displayed the heroic self-sacrificing spirit of safeguarding the security of the headquarters of the revolution in an unexpected circumstance.

articles.title: Pyongyang Spring Int'l Trade Fair to Open
articles.content:
Pyongyang Spring Int'l Trade Fair to Open 
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The 16th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair will take place in the Three-Revolution Exhibition House from May 13 to 16. 
					 It will bring together companies of the DPRK, Germany, Malaysia, Mongolia, Switzerland, Singapore, Australia, Italy, Indonesia, China, Poland and Chinese Taipei. 
					
					 Exhibited in the fair will be machines, electric and electronic products, light industrial goods, foodstuffs, medical instruments, medicines, building materials, chemical goods and vehicles. The fair will contribute to boosting cooperation and exchange in trade, economic and scientific and technological fields among countries and regions.

articles.title: Korean Socialism Is Sure to Win: Newspaper
articles.content:
Korean Socialism Is Sure to Win: Newspaper
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun on Sunday marks the 22nd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Our Socialism Centred on the Masses Shall Not Perish." 
					 The work, released on May 5, Juche 80 (1991), defines Korean socialism as one based on the Juche idea and centred on the masses.
					
					 It fully clarifies the advantages and vitality of Korean socialism and solid and invincible socialist system of the DPRK based on Juche in which the leader, party and the masses are united in single mind.
					
					 The work serves as an ideological and spiritual pabulum that inspires the army and people of the DPRK with conviction of victorious socialism and as a powerful weapon that deals harsh blow to the imperialists in their anti-socialist moves, the daily says in an article, and goes on:
					
					 Over the past twenty odd years since the release of the work, Korean socialism has made great strides, recording one victory after another in its history.
					
					 Korean socialism owes its invincibility to the great Juche idea, Songun idea and close unity of whole society.
					
					 The DPRK people regard socialism as their life and soul.
					
					 Socialism is the future of humankind and it is one of the inevitabilities of history that Korean socialism will surely emerge victorious.

articles.title: Just Cause of Global Independence Will Emerge Victorious: Newspaper
articles.content:
Just Cause of Global Independence Will Emerge Victorious: Newspaper 
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The just cause of global independence will surely emerge victorious, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday. 
					 Since the end of the Cold War, the U.S. has persisted in the efforts to establish a uni-polar world, styling itself the "only superpower in the world," the daily says in an article, adding:
					
					 What the U.S. is seeking is to benumbing people in their sense of independence and reason by zealously advertising American-style "democracy" in the international arena so as to put the whole world under its control. 
					
					 Particularly, the U.S. is employing economic sanctions and military threats to prevent progressive countries from defending their sovereignty and achieving democratic development. 
					
					 The U.S. makes military attack against those countries disobedient to it, while attracting those countries in economic chaos with bait of "aid". 
					
					 However, the U.S. efforts for a uni-polar world will come to grief as they are anachronistic ones to reverse the trend of the history towards independence and justice. 
					
					 Now increasing in the world is the number of the nations which regard their sovereignty as their lives, standing against the U.S. moves of aggression. 
					
					 Victory is in store for the DPRK service personnel and people all out in the struggle to defend sovereignty and the world progressives loving justice and peace.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses Tragic Situation of S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses Tragic Situation of S. Korea 
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialist aggressors in south Korea squeeze a fabulous amount of money from south Korea under the pretext of "defense cost sharing" to prepare a war against the DPRK. They even use some of the money for what is irrelevant to military expenditure, like the building of a museum and restaurant in their military bases in south Korea. 
					 It was also reported that they used money for salaries of employees of a hotel operated by them and for their money-lending business. 
					
					 The facts show that the U.S. imperialists regard south Korea just as their colonial guard and that they are arrogant and shameless aggressors and plunderers who make profits and enjoy pleasure with blood and sweats of the south Korean people, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday.
					
					 The upkeep of the U.S. forces squeezed from south Korea is enough to spare, but the U.S. is pressing south Korea for more money, 50 percent of "the defense cost sharing" from 42 percent now, the newspaper says in a commentary, and goes on: 
					
					 "The defense cost sharing" is nonsensical from the view of the aggressive nature and criminal acts of the U.S. troops in south Korea. 
					
					 The present tragic situation of south Korea is an inevitable product of despicable treachery of those staking their fate on the U.S. and running amuck in confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the DPRK. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities spare nothing for pleasing their U.S. master and pleading for cooperation in their war moves against the DPRK. This is the height of treachery.

articles.title: U.S. Moves for War Block under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Moves for War Block under Fire 
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The U.S. has established an Asian missile defence system involving Japan and south Korea, while making closer its military cooperative ties with Japan and south Korea respectively.
					 It is also zealously instigating Japan and south Korea to forge a military alliance.
					
					 In this regard Minju Joson on Sunday observes in a commentary:
					
					 The U.S. is explaining the moves as for "protecting" the U.S. forces and its allies from possible "military provocation" by the DPRK, but the fact is not that simple as it explains.
					
					 The U.S. has long pursued a plan for establishing in the Asian-Pacific region a triangular military alliance involving Japan and south Korea, in other words an Asia-version NATO to take military supremacy in the region.
					
					 But things have not gone well as it wished in forming an alliance between Japan and south Korea for neighboring powers' strong warning and opposition and for historical reasons.
					
					 The U.S. is judging that now when a touch-and-go situation is prevailing in the Korean Peninsula is the high time for establishing a war block under the pretext of "threat from north Korea."
					
					 It is undoubted that the situation in the Asian-Pacific will remain tense as long as the U.S. regards the region as the most important one vital to their interests.
					
					 After moving its strategic center for world domination to the Asian-Pacific, the U.S. is taking the DPRK as the first target of attack. 
					
					 Under such situation it is urgent for the DPRK to bolster up national defence capability in every way.

articles.title: April Issue of Magazine Paektu-Halla Published
articles.content:
April Issue of Magazine Paektu-Halla Published 
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The General Association of Koreans in China released the April issue of its magazine Paektu-Halla. 
					 Conspicuous in the magazine is a photo of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung waving back to the enthusiastically cheering masses. 
					
					 The magazine carries the concluding speech of the dear respected Kim Jong Un at the March 2013 Plenary Meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 It also carries stories about Kim Il Sung's 250-mile journey for learning to the motherland in his teens and about great efforts of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for increased production of consumer goods. 
					
					 Seen in the magazine is a message of greeting Kim Jong Un sent to Xi Jinping, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China. 
					
					 It gives the news of the 7th Session of the 12th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK in which amendments to the Socialist Constitution of the DPRK were made. 
					
					 It contains articles written by Koreans in China such as "Celebration of Day of the Sun" and "In Motherland". 
					
					 It also carries a news report of a meeting held by the Shenyang City branch of the General Association of Koreans in China to denounce the U.S. imperialists and south Korean puppet regime for creating an acute situation on the Korean peninsula with their reckless confrontation and war moves, as well as a statement issued by the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration. 
					
					 It introduces the art troupe of Koreans in China participating in the 3rd April Spring People's Art Festival held in Pyongyang and gives homeland and international news stories.

articles.title: World Forum on Peace of Korean Peninsula Held in France
articles.content:
World Forum on Peace of Korean Peninsula Held in France
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- A world forum on peace of the Korean Peninsula took place in France on April 20.
					 Present there were political and public figures and members of organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people in different countries, including France and Germany.
					
					 Speaking at the forum, the vice-president of the France-Korea Friendship Association talked about the background of the nuclear issue on the peninsula and its essence.
					
					 Peace on the Korean Peninsula is not threatened by the DPRK but by the U.S. seeking to rule the world after putting the Asia-Pacific region under its control, the vice-president said, adding:
					
					 The U.S. has escalated tension, not promoting peace, in the region for its world supremacy strategy.
					
					 The DPRK's access to nuclear weapons is a result of the persistent threat by the U.S.
					
					 The DPRK's nuclear deterrent and its scientific and technological strength guarantee peace in the region.
					
					 Other speakers expressed deep concern about the touch-and-go situation prevailing on the peninsula due to the new war preparations of the U.S. They denounced the U.S. for such highhanded and arbitrary practices as violating international law and the UN Charter and engaging in aggression and interference in independent countries.
					
					 They called upon peace champions of the world to launch activities for checking the U.S. moves to start another war on the peninsula.

articles.title: Bulletin Issued in France
articles.content:
Bulletin Issued in France
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The France-Korea Friendship Association issued a bulletin on April 28.
					 Conspicuous in the bulletin is a photo of the statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill in Pyongyang.
					
					 In an article the bulletin introduces grand celebrations of the Day of the Shining Star (birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il) in the DPRK and France. 
					
					 It also deals with the activities conducted by the association against the U.S. imperialists' nuclear threat towards the DPRK.

articles.title: Cuban Paper Accuses U.S. of Deteriorating Korean Peninsula Situation
articles.content:
Cuban Paper Accuses U.S. of Deteriorating Korean Peninsula Situation
						
 Pyongyang, May 5 (KCNA) -- The Cuban paper Granma carried a commentary titled "Adding fuel to the flames on the Korean Peninsula" on April 27.
					 The commentary revealed that historically, the U.S. has violated the Korean Armistice Agreement, frequently staging war drills against the DPRK.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Recently, the situation on the Korean Peninsula has been worsened due to the U.S. seeking to increase its influence in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 From March 1 the U.S. has staged war drills together with south Korea with huge aggressor troops and nuclear strike means involved. Such saber-rattling has compelled the DPRK to take strong countermeasures.
					
					 The U.S. is adding fuel to the flames by introducing latest war means into the peninsula.
					
					 The acute situation on the peninsula is suitable to the U.S. in its effort to extend the sphere of its influence to the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 A high-ranking official of the European Union told a press conference that in its aggression moves the U.S. pursues a strategic aim to press China and Russia after occupying the DPRK.
					
					 We should bear in mind again that the imperialists' ambition is pushing the world to another nuclear crisis.
